meanings.definition: Make or declare (something, typically a church) sacred for religious use.
meanings.sent1: The priest consecrates the new church with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The bishop consecrates the holy water before the service.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel consecrates its favorite acorn by burying it in the ground.
meanings.sent4: The artist consecrates the canvas with vibrant colors, turning it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual consecrates the sacred ground, filling it with divine energy.

meanings.definition: Devote (something) exclusively to a particular purpose or use.
meanings.sent1: She consecrates her time to volunteering at the local shelter.
meanings.sent2: The king consecrates his sword to defending the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The chef consecrates the secret recipe to only a few trusted cooks.
meanings.sent4: The author consecrates his latest book to his loyal readers.
meanings.sent5: The gardener consecrates the garden to growing the most beautiful flowers in town.
